intro: Tetranthera ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
